Structure of a BJT

The basic structure of a BJT (Bipolar Junction Transistor)

Currents for I-V in a BJT

Expected results

Electron currents by the theory

  1. Electron currents
InE=AEqDnnpoLncoth⁡(WLn){[exp⁡(qVBEkT)−1]−sech⁡(WLn)[exp⁡(qVBCkT)−1]}InC=AEqDnnpoLncosech⁡(WLn){[exp⁡(qVBEkT)−1]−coth⁡(WLn)[exp⁡(qVBCkT)−1]}\begin{array}{l}{I_{n E}=\frac{A_{E} q D_{n} n_{p o}}{L_{n}} \operatorname{coth}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right)\left\{\left[\exp \left(\frac{q V_{B E}}{k T}\right)-1\right]-\operatorname{sech}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right)\left[\exp \left(\frac{q V_{B C}}{k T}\right)-1\right]\right\}} \\ {I_{n C}=\frac{A_{E} q D_{n} n_{p o}}{L_{n}} \operatorname{cosech}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right)\left\{\left[\exp \left(\frac{q V_{B E}}{k T}\right)-1\right]-\operatorname{coth}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right)\left[\exp \left(\frac{q V_{B C}}{k T}\right)-1\right]\right\}}\end{array}InE​=Ln​AE​qDn​npo​​coth(Ln​W​){[exp(kTqVBE​​)−1]−sech(Ln​W​)[exp(kTqVBC​​)−1]}InC​=Ln​AE​qDn​npo​​cosech(Ln​W​){[exp(kTqVBE​​)−1]−coth(Ln​W​)[exp(kTqVBC​​)−1]}​
  1. Electron currents at the boundaries
InE=AEqDnnpoLncoth⁡(WLn)exp⁡(qVBEkT)InC=AEqDnnpoLncosech⁡(WLn)exp⁡(qVBEkT)\begin{array}{l}{I_{n E}=\frac{A_{E} q D_{n} n_{p o}}{L_{n}} \operatorname{coth}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right) \exp \left(\frac{q V_{B E}}{k T}\right)} \\ {I_{n C}=\frac{A_{E} q D_{n} n_{p o}}{L_{n}} \operatorname{cosech}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right) \exp \left(\frac{q V_{B E}}{k T}\right)}\end{array}InE​=Ln​AE​qDn​npo​​coth(Ln​W​)exp(kTqVBE​​)InC​=Ln​AE​qDn​npo​​cosech(Ln​W​)exp(kTqVBE​​)​

Current gain

  1. Current gain
hFE=γ1−γ=npoDnWEpnoEDpELncoth⁡(WLn)hFE≈ICIB∝exp⁡(qVBE/kT)exp⁡(qVBE/mkT)\begin{aligned} h_{F E} &=\frac{\gamma}{1-\gamma}=\frac{n_{p o} D_{n} W_{E}}{p_{n o E} D_{p E} L_{n}} \operatorname{coth}\left(\frac{W}{L_{n}}\right) \\ h_{F E} & \approx \frac{I_{C}}{I_{B}} \propto \frac{\exp \left(q V_{B E} / k T\right)}{\exp \left(q V_{B E} / m k T\right)} \end{aligned}hFE​hFE​​=1−γγ​=pnoE​DpE​Ln​npo​Dn​WE​​coth(Ln​W​)≈IB​IC​​∝exp(qVBE​/mkT)exp(qVBE​/kT)​​

  1. Conventional parameters for a Bipolar Transistor

SW Manual

Geometry of the designed npn-BJT

The black region is electron doping region. Nd is electron doping density.

The yellow region is hole doping region. Na is hole doping density.

The depth is set to be 1 um.

Parameter information

The default values of intrinsic carrier density (ni)\left(n_{i}\right)(ni​), hole mobility(μp)\left(\mu_{p}\right)(μp​), and electron mobility (μn)\left(\mu_{n}\right)(μn​) are often taken in the case of Si.

Hole doping density (Na) and electron doping density (Nd) can be changed a little from the default values.

IV mode 1: Common emitter

IV mode 2: Common base

Fixed Voltage is VB\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{B}}VB​ fixed in the common emitter mode or VE\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{E}}VE​ fixed in the common base mode.

Initial V, Final V, and V step are VB\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{B}}VB​ values in the common emitter mode and VE\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{E}}VE​ values in the common base mode.

Output examples
